page.title: 05Farmwork in Summer
page.content: My Dad is a tractor man. He gets up at seven o'clock in the morning and goes away to work at eight o'clock. He starts work at half past eight. When he gets to work he checks his tractor to see if it is in good condition. Then he gets all the other tractors ready too. He takes all the silage trailers out to the silage fields. Silage is grass which is cut in the summer and then is stored till the winter when the cattle eat it. When he is finished cutting the silage he puts his tractor in the shed and the he comes home. Sometimes it is five o'clock but it is later when he is busy. There are two, and sometimes three cuts of silage in the summer. It is stored in silage clamps on the farm and as it gets older it has a funny smell but the cattle like it and it is nutritious.
